message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: 
File #1
public class ViolinGonzalezAP3 {    
    public static int numberOfStrings = 4;        
    public static char[] stringNames = {'E', 'A', 'D', 'G'};        
    public static boolean isTuned = false;        
    public static boolean isPlaying = false;        
    public static int numberOfViolins = 0;    

    public ViolinGonzalezAP3(){            
        numberOfViolins++;        
    }        

    public static void startPlaying() {            
        isPlaying = true;            
        System.out.println(" violin is now playing.");        
    }        

    public static void stopPlaying() {            
        isPlaying = false;            
        System.out.println(" violin has stopped playing.");        
    }        

    public static void tuneOn() {            
        isTuned = true;            
        System.out.println(" violin is now tuned.");        
    }        

    public static void tuneOff() {            
        isTuned = false;            
        System.out.println(" violin is untuned.");        
    }         

    public static int getNumberOfViolins(){            
        return numberOfViolins;        
    }        

    public static int getNumberOfStrings(){            
        return numberOfStrings;        
    }        

    public static char[] notes(){            
        return stringNames;        
    }    
}       

File #2
import java.io.*;import java.util.Arrays;
public class ViolinDriverGonzalezAP3 {    
    public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception{        
        java.io.File file = new java.io.File("Java violinOutput.txt");        
        PrintWriter output = new PrintWriter(file);        
        ViolinGonzalezAP3[] violinAmount = new ViolinGonzalezAP3[10];        
        for (int i = 0; i < violinAmount.length; i++){            
            violinAmount[i] = new ViolinGonzalezAP3();            
            System.out.println(ViolinGonzalezAP3.getNumberOfViolins() + " Violin");            
            output.write(ViolinGonzalezAP3.getNumberOfViolins() + " object:\n");            
            violinAmount[i].tuneOff();            
            output.write("The violin is now tunning...\n");            
            violinAmount[i].tuneOn();                       
            output.write("The violin is now playing...\n");            
            violinAmount[i].startPlaying();            
            output.write("String numbers is " + ViolinGonzalezAP3.getNumberOfStrings() + " with String names are " + Arrays.toString(ViolinGonzalezAP3.notes()) + "\n");            
            output.write("The violin is now stopped\n");            
            violinAmount[i].stopPlaying();        
        }        
        output.close();   
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The "cannot resolve" error usually occurs when the class you are trying to use is not in the same package or not imported properly. In your case, you are trying to use the Violin class which is defined in the ViolinGonzalezAP3 file. However, you are trying to create an instance of Violin in the ViolinDriverGonzalezAP3 file without importing the ViolinGonzalezAP3 file. To fix this, you need to make sure that the ViolinGonzalezAP3 class is in the same package as the ViolinDriverGonzalezAP3 class. Also, you need to create an instance of ViolinGonzalezAP3 instead of Violin. Furthermore, you need to make the methods and variables in the ViolinGonzalezAP3 class static so that they can be accessed without creating an instance of the class. Finally, you should use the write method of the PrintWriter class to write the output to the file.

<<<code>>>: $CODE

Question: How can I calculate the sum of an array in Java?
Please using this api: Arrays.stream.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Arrays.stream
<<<code>>>: int[] array = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
int sum = Arrays.stream(array).sum();
<<<explanation>>>: The sum() method of the IntStream class returns the sum of elements in this stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation.

One defines a class and all of it's methods and another constructs an instance of this class. My project requires that we write the output from the class methods to a file.When I try to import file 1 into file 2 I keep getting "cannot resolve" error any ideas why?            System.out.println(" violin is now playing.");        }        public void stopPlaying() {            isPlaying = false;            System.out.println(" violin has stopped playing.");        }        public void tuneOn() {            isTuned = true;            System.out.println(Violin.getNumberOfViolins() + " Violin");            output.println(Violin.getNumberOfViolins() + " object:");            violinAmount[i].tuneOff();            output.println("The violin is now tunning...");            violinAmount[i].tuneOn();                       output.println("The violin is now playing...");            violinAmount[i].startPlaying();            output.println("String numbers is " + Violin.getNumberOfStrings() + " with String names are " + Arrays.toString(Violin.notes()));            output.println("The violin is now stopped");            violinAmount[i].stopPlaying();        }        output.close();   }}
